titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Education and Culture Program, Grant Files of Terry T. Saario

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Education and Culture Program, Grant Files of Terry T. Saario

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimal Processing has been conducted to establish basic intellectual and physical control of the material and assess immediate preservation and conservation needs. Material remains as received, in original folders and storage boxes.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Terry Tinson Saario's career has included positions in research, philanthropy, the Federal Government, and business. During the 1970s, she worked as a Program Officer in the Ford Foundation's Division of Education and Research and related education programs.

After leaving the Ford Foundation, Saario worked in the Carter Administration as a Deputy Assistant Secretary for Planning and Program Integration in the Department of Education's Office of Educational Research and Improvement. She later served as Vice President for Communications at the Pillsbury Company and President of the Northwest Area Foundation.

Saario completed her undergraduate education at the University of California, Riverside in 1963. She then earned a Master of Arts Degree from UC Riverside in 1966 and a Ph.D. from the Claremont Graduate School in 1970.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.
